creator: William Mountfort
description:
LibriVox recording of The Life and Death of Doctor Faustus Made into a Farce by William Mountfort.
Read in English.

First produced between 1684-1688, this - as the title says - is Faust played as a comedy. Angels to go along with Mephistopholis and Lucifer and Beelzebub, sure, but also the Seven Deadly Sins and wait a minute - Scaramouche and Harlequin?? (The author Mountfort was also an actor and was killed trying to prevent an attempt to kidnap an actress in a case that ended up in the House of Lords.) - Summary by ToddHW

Cast list:
Dr Faustus: Beth Thomas
Mephistopholis: Ian Quinlan
Good Angel: Frances Brown
Bad Angel: TriciaG
Scaramouche: alanmapstone
Harlequin: Anastasiia Solokha
Lucifer: Chuck Williamson
Beelzebub: Availle
Pride: Rapunzelina
Covetousness: russellhughes
Envy: Mary Kay
Wrath: Kristin Gjerløw
Gluttony: Elizabeth Klett
Sloth: Anna Simon
Leachery: bala
Giant: David Olson
Horse-courser: ToddHW
Carter: Kadier Carter
Hostess: Kristin Gjerløw
Old Man: Rapunzelina
Emperor: russellhughes
Benoolio: David Olson
Lord: Gillian Schnurr
Second Lord: ToddHW
Poor : bala
Second Poor : Rapunzelina
Third Poor : ToddHW
Fourth Poor : TriciaG
Scholar: Elizabeth Klett
Stage Directions: ToddHW

Edited By:  ToddHW


For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording.

For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org.
